org.apparatus_templi.service

Class SQLiteDbService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.service.DatabaseService
      • org.apparatus_templi.service.SQLiteDbService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceInterface

    public class SQLiteDbService
extends DatabaseService
implements ServiceInterface
    A singleton database service using SQLite as the backend.
    Author:
    Kimberly Riley , Jonathan Nelson

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SQLiteDbService getInstance()
        Returns the SQLiteDbService instance

      • storeTextData

        public int storeTextData(String driverName,
                String dataTag,
                String data)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: DatabaseService
        Stores the given data to persistent storage. Data is tagged with both the driver name as well as a data tag.
        Specified by:
        storeTextData in class DatabaseService
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the driver to store the data under
        dataTag - a tag to assign to this data. This tag should be specific for each data block that your driver stores. If there already exits data for the given dataTag the old data will be overwritten.
        data - the text data to be stored. The data must not be null.
        Returns:
        -1 if data overwrote information from a previous dataTag. 1 if data was written successfully. 0 if the data could not be written or if the given data was null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • storeBinData

        public int storeBinData(String driverName,
               String dataTag,
               byte[] data)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: DatabaseService
        Stores the given data to persistent storage. Data is stored based off the given driverName and dataTag.
        Specified by:
        storeBinData in class DatabaseService
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the driver to store the data under
        dataTag - a unique tag to assign to this data. This tag should be specific for each data block that will be stored. If data has already been stored with the same driverName and dataTag the old data will be overwritten.
        data - the data to be stored. The data must not be null.
        Returns:
        -1 if data overwrote information from a previous dataTag. 1 if data was written successfully. 0 if the data could not be written or if the given data was null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • readTextData

        public String readTextData(String driverName,
                  String dataTag)
        Description copied from class: DatabaseService
        Returns text data previously stored under the given module name and tag.
        Specified by:
        readTextData in class DatabaseService
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the calling driver
        dataTag - the tag to uniquely identify the data
        Returns:
        the stored String data, or null if no data has been stored under the given driver name and tag.

      • readBinData

        public byte[] readBinData(String driverName,
                 String dataTag)
        Description copied from class: DatabaseService
        Returns binary data previously stored under the given module name and tag.
        Specified by:
        readBinData in class DatabaseService
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the calling driver
        dataTag - the tag to uniquely identify the data
        Returns:
        the stored binary data, or null if no data has been stored under the given driver name and tag.

        public void preferencesChanged()
        Description copied from interface: ServiceInterface
        Notify the service that preferences have changed. The service should re-query the saved preferences for any changes relevant to its environment and adjust behavior as needed.
        Specified by:
        preferencesChanged in interface ServiceInterface

      • stopService

        public void stopService()
        Description copied from interface: ServiceInterface
        Notify the service that it will be stopped. The service should save any data needed, close all open connections, and refrain from allocating any new resources.
        Specified by:
        stopService in interface ServiceInterface

      • getTextTags

        public ArrayList<String> getTextTags()
        Description copied from class: DatabaseService
        Returns an ArrayList of Strings representing the dataTags that have been used to store text data.
        Specified by:
        getTextTags in class DatabaseService
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of String tags. If no text data has been stored then returns an empty list.

      • getBinTags

        Description copied from class: DatabaseService

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        an ArrayList of String tags. If no binary data has been stored then returns an empty list.
